intro: Bourreria stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf burrhead, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
